summary: This is a federal indictment filed against correctional officers Tova Noel and Michael Thomas for conspiracy and making false records related to their failure to conduct mandated inmate counts and rounds at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) on August 9-10, 2019, during which time inmate Jeffrey Epstein committed suicide while unobserved. This is a federal indictment document charging two Bureau of Prisons correctional officers, Tova Noel and Michael Thomas, with making false records regarding inmate counts in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) on August 10, 2019. The document alleges they falsified count slips indicating they performed counts they did not actually conduct.

connections.description: Co-defendants charged with conspiring to defraud the United States by falsifying count slips and failing to perform their duties as correctional officers on the night of Epstein's suicide.
Noel was one of the correctional officers assigned to guard Epstein in the SHU and was responsible for conducting counts and rounds to ensure his safety.
Thomas was a correctional officer who responded to Epstein's prior suicide attempt on July 23, 2019, and was on duty the night of Epstein's death.
Berman, as United States Attorney, is prosecuting Noel on behalf of the United States government.
Berman, as United States Attorney, is prosecuting Thomas on behalf of the United States government.

events.title: Epstein Arrest and Incarceration
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was arrested and detained at the MCC on federal sex trafficking charges.

events.title: Epstein's Prior Apparent Suicide Attempt
events.description: MCC officers, including Michael Thomas, found Epstein in his SHU cell with a strip of bedsheet around his neck. He was placed on suicide watch.

events.title: Failure to Perform Counts and Rounds
events.description: Correctional officers Tova Noel and Michael Thomas failed to conduct mandated institutional counts at 4 p.m., 10 p.m., 12 a.m., 3 a.m., and 5 a.m., and falsified the corresponding count slips.

events.title: Discovery of Epstein's Body
events.description: At approximately 6:30 a.m., Noel and Thomas entered Epstein's tier to serve breakfast and found him unresponsive with a noose around his neck. He was later declared dead at a hospital.

events.title: False Count Slips Submitted at MCC
events.description: Tova Noel and Michael Thomas allegedly created, signed, and submitted false count slips indicating they performed the 3 a.m. and 5 a.m. institutional counts of the SHU when they had not actually done so.

events.title: Indictment Filed
events.description: The indictment against Tova Noel and Michael Thomas was filed in the United States District Court for the Southern District of New York.

locations: Special Housing Unit (SHU) at MCC, ninth floor
keyFacts: Correctional officers Tova Noel and Michael Thomas are charged with conspiracy and falsifying records for failing to perform any inmate counts or rounds in the SHU from approximately 10:30 p.m. on August 9 to 6:30 a.m. on August 10, 2019.
Jeffrey Epstein was found dead by suicide in his cell during this period of no monitoring, despite a prior suicide attempt on July 23, 2019, and a psychological directive that he have a cellmate.
Video surveillance confirmed that no officer entered Epstein's tier from approximately 10:30 p.m. on August 9 until 6:30 a.m. on August 10.
Noel and Thomas admitted to failing to perform counts and rounds, with Thomas stating 'we messed up' and 'we didn't do any rounds.'

The indictment details five specific false count slips submitted for the 4 p.m., 10 p.m., 12 a.m., 3 a.m., and 5 a.m. institutional counts, all of which were cleared by the Control Center based on the falsified documents.
Two Bureau of Prisons correctional officers, Tova Noel and Michael Thomas, were indicted for falsifying official records.
The alleged falsification occurred on August 10, 2019, at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC).
The false records were count slips for the 3 a.m. and 5 a.m. institutional counts of the Special Housing Unit (SHU).
The charges include violations of Title 18, United States Code, Sections 371, 1001(a)(3), and 2.
The indictment was filed by United States Attorney Geoffrey S. Berman.
